fields.text: Simplicity, carried to the extreme, becomes elegance.
fields.author: Jon Franklin

fields.text: The function of good software is to make the complex appear to be simple.
fields.author: Grady Booch

fields.text: There are two ways of constructing a software design. One way is to make it so simple that there are obviously no deficiencies. And the other way is to make it so complicated that there are no obvious deficiencies.
fields.author: C.A.R. Hoare

fields.text: Controlling complexity is the essence of computer programming.
fields.author: Brian Kernigan

fields.text: To iterate is human, to recurse divine.
fields.author: L. Peter Deutsch

fields.text: I wish developing great products was as easy as writing a check. If that was the case, Microsoft would have great products.
fields.author: Steve Jobs

fields.text: Good code is its own best documentation.
fields.author: Steve McConnell

fields.text: Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.
fields.author: Abelson and Sussman

fields.text: Make everything as simple as possible, but not simpler.
fields.author: Albert Einstein

fields.text: The difference between theory and practice is that in theory, there is no difference between theory and practice.
fields.author: Richard Moore

fields.text: You can't just ask customers what they want and then try to give that to them. By the time you get it built, they'll want something new.
fields.author: Steve Jobs

fields.text: Looking at code you wrote more than two weeks ago is like looking at code you are seeing for the first time.
fields.author: Dan Hurvitz

fields.text: Any code of your own that you haven’t looked at for six or more months might as well have been written by someone else.
fields.author: Eagleson’s Law
